Articles.Content:
I'm genuinely curious about this after upgrading to a new SSD (and reading that some ppl have 25 minute + load times). So let's collate some data.

---

Time: 57 sec

SSD: Samsung 970 EVO Plus 1TB

Mods: stock + both expansions only

---

edit: you can check load times in the console once the main menu loads (ALT+F12 on windows)

Even with 0 patches applied, ModuleManager added 15s+

Edited January 12, 2022 by sunnypunny

1:32 to get the start menu, 1:56 to load the game save.

I have a low budget SDD in a 4yr old computer.

Mods: both expansions, MechJeb2 and AFBW

1:20 to the start menu

Western Digital WDS240G2

Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
i5-3570K @4.1GHz

Modlist:
Breaking Ground (BreakingGround-DLC 1.7.1)
ClickThrough Blocker (ClickThroughBlocker 1:0.1.10.17)
EVA Struts (EVAStruts 6.0)
EVA Transfer (EVATransfer 9.0)
IndicatorLights (IndicatorLights 1.8.1)
Kerbal Alarm Clock (KerbalAlarmClock v3.13.0.0)
Kerbal Engineer Redux (KerbalEngineerRedux 1.1.9.0)
MechJeb 2 (MechJeb2 2.12.3.0)
Module Manager (ModuleManager 4.2.1)
Science Relay (ScienceRelay 6.0)
ScienceAlert ReAlerted (ScienceAlert 1.9.9.3)
Toolbar Controller (ToolbarController 1:0.1.9.6)
Zero MiniAVC (ZeroMiniAVC 1:1.1.2.4)

lemme blow all you out of the water

I sit at my poor, poor laptop for 25 minutes at a time waiting for the game to initially start up. KSP 1.12.3 on a HDD.

My 2 and a half year old PS4 loads the game in about 2 minutes and 30 seconds.

Wow! Yall PC users really can't live without mods!
It used to be anywhere from 15-30 minutes but now with my new laptop its like 5 minutes.

Edited January 10, 2022 by Gurkonier

About 3-5 minutes (depends on tracked objects amount)

Xbox One

Both DLCs installed

Edited January 10, 2022 by BekfastDerp13

Okay, here it goes (since you've asked for it):

  • [KSP] KSP 1.12.3 (vanilla, both DLCs): 5 minutes.

1 minute ago, adsii1970 said:

It probably would be for me too, if I weren't running Slack, Discord, and Firefox (and about ten other things) in the background.

I usually try not to have anything else open when I'm playing KSP, save for Steam, occasionally.

KSP installed on an M2 SSD.

KSP 1.3.1 pure stock: just under 20 secs to main menu.  (compare the exact same install copied to and started from a 7200 rpm HDD: just under 42 secs to main menu)

KSP 1.12.3 pure stock, no DLC: just under 25 secs to main menu.

KSP 1.12.3 stock+DLC: just over 71 secs to main menu.

(Interesting: I can start a stock+DLC 1.12.3, immediately start and stop 1.3.1 three times in a row... and still catch 1.12.3 cycling through its final loading screens. Why the disproportionate extra loading time for the DLC?)

At the time of this test, I had open -aside from some background stuff- FireFox (30-ish tabs open), Steam, Skype, a handful of Explorer windows and three editors working on large text files. I've not noticed much difference even with heavier application loads, so I don't usually bother with closing stuff before launching KSP.

I currently don't have any modded instances installed to compare. Although unless we test perfectly identical modsets, comparisons are next to meaningless.

My lil’-laptop-that-can gets, I don’t have precise times, but I’ll guess around 10 to 15 minutes.

That’s with probably around 70 mods.

Edited January 11, 2022 by Hyperspace Industries

For my current vanilla install (with both DLCs) of 1.12.3, the game takes about a minute and 15 seconds to start up.

On my old computer it took up to 5 minutes without any DLC or mods.
About 1:25 with both DLC and 14 mods to the start screen.

1.12.3, with BG and MH expansion packs, no mods.

Takes 1 min 51 seconds from clicking the file to start screen.

3 year old MacBook Pro, 13”.

It appears a significant portion of that load time is for the expansion packs.

1m 20s to the start menu

  -  Both DLC's, Kerbal Engineer, Kerbal Alarm Clock

  -  i7 4770, 32GB RAM, SSD
